title: Southeast Asia gaming revenue share 2013 - 2017 , by country
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 7 lines representing Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam, and Rest of SEA. The y axis denotes Revenue share and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Indonesia, and Philippines are gradually increasing, Singapore is gradually decreasing, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, and Rest of SEA are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
Overall across the Year, Thailand mostly maintained the highest Revenue share when compared to others with a mean value of 21.4, and it peaked at 2016, and 2017.
Followed by Malaysia which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 19.0 Revenue share,reaching its highest point  at 2014 with a value of 20.0.
The botommost line, Rest of SEA,  has a mean of 1.6, and peaked at 2015, 2016, and 2017.

After Thailand, Malaysia overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 19.0, peaking at 2014.
Rest of SEA mostly had the least Revenue share with a mean value of 1.6, which peaked at 2015, 2016, and 2017 with a value of 2.0.
